heisig_chinese_memo: The scarecrows come alive at night and contend to see who can chase down the most vultures with a rake.
Ru_trainchinese: zhēng: (глаг) бороться за, оспаривать; сражаться, бороться; ссориться, спорить
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: This can be seen as a Retarius, a roman gladiator. The Retiarius always fought with a net and rake to bound up his opponents, and with a trident, which was able to pierce enemies after tying them. They were terrific contenders, so they were only paired with gladiators specially equipped to fight them.
humanum_full_description_en:
Oracle " fight " from the second word " and " from ◎, like plowing the shape (Liu Hongtao), or think like a couple of plow-shaped (JIA). ◎The bottom is triangular, like a plow used for farming. " Again " like a hand. The word " struggle " is like two hands (representing two people) dragging a ploughshare to farm. Originally meant farming, under the pretense of " struggle " for contention , the original meaning of farming has been abandoned.

Mr. Lu Maode said in "A Study on Bronze Plows on Discovery in China": "The plow is a plow, and the initial pull is with people.... Two people work at the same time, one at the back to help the plow, the other to pull the plow at the front, so two people Parallel coupling is called coupling."

In the inscriptions, Zheng is the zhenren in the first period of Wuding era, and he is also a historian. Inscriptions no " fight " word, used only as a radical, " quiet " "The word from the fight " word, from the second " and " from " strength ," " force " like the shape tools, and " plow " the beginning of the text It can be used universally as a symbol. Refer to the word " quiet ".

"Shuowen": "Yiye." Duan Yucai's note: "Whoever argues with words means that the envoy belongs to oneself." Xu Haojian: "The original meaning of fighting is to fight for one thing with two hands."
humanum_short_description_en: Oracle's " struggle " means to plow the plow, which means that two hands (representing two people) drag a ploughshare to plow. This means farming, pretending to be the meaning of contention.
humanum_full_description:
甲骨文「爭」字從二「又」從◎，象犁耕之形(劉洪濤)，或認為象耦耕之形(賈文)。◎下呈三角形，象農耕用的犁。「又」象手形。「爭」字象兩隻手(代表兩個人)拖動一個犁鏵耕作的樣子。本來表示耕作，假借為爭奪的「爭」，耕作之本義已廢。

　　陸懋德先生在《中國發現之上古銅犁考》中說：「耜是犁頭，而最初的牽用人拉。……二人同時工作，一人在後扶犁，一人在前拉犁，如此二人並耦，是謂之耦也。」

　　卜辭中，爭是第一期武丁時代的貞人，又是史官。金文無「爭」字，只用作偏旁，「靜」字所從的「爭」字，從二「又」從「力」，「力」象農具之形，與「犁」的初文作為義符可通用。參「靜」字。

　　《說文》：「引也。」段玉裁注：「凡言爭者，皆謂引之使歸於己。」徐灝箋：「爭之本義為兩手爭一物。」
humanum_short_description: 甲骨文「爭」表示把犁而耕，會兩隻手(代表兩個人)拖動一個犁鏵耕作的樣子。本表示耕作，假借為爭奪之義。

①力求獲得，互不相讓：爭奪。競爭。爭長論短。
②力求實現：爭取。爭氣。爭勝。
③方言，差，欠：總數還爭多少？
④怎麼，如何(多見於詩、詞、曲)：爭不。爭知。爭奈。

They were terrific contenders, so they were only paired with gladiators specially equipped to fight them.

甲骨文「 爭 」字從二「 又 」從◎，象犁耕之形(劉洪濤)，或認為象耦耕之形(賈文)。◎下呈三角形，象農耕用的犁。「 又 」象手形。「 爭 」字象兩隻手(代表兩個人)拖動一個犁鏵耕作的樣子。本來表示耕作，假借為爭奪的「 爭 」，耕作之本義已廢。 陸懋德先生在《中國發現之上古銅犁考》中說：「耜是犁頭，而最初的牽用人拉。……二人同時工作，一人在後扶犁，一人在前拉犁，如此二人並耦，是謂之耦也。」 卜辭中，爭是第一期武丁時代的貞人，又是史官。金文無「 爭 」字，只用作偏旁，「 靜 」字所從的「 爭 」字，從二「 又 」從「 力 」，「 力 」象農具之形，與「 犁 」的初文作為義符可通用。參「 靜 」字。 《說文》：「引也。」段玉裁注：「凡言爭者，皆謂引之使歸於己。」徐灝箋：「爭之本義為兩手爭一物。」

" Again" like a hand. The word " struggle" is like two hands (representing two people) dragging a ploughshare to farm. Originally meant farming, under the pretense of " struggle" for contention, the original meaning of farming has been abandoned. Mr. Lu Maode said in "A Study on Bronze Plows on Discovery in China": "The plow is a plow, and the initial pull is with people.... Two people work at the same time, one at the back to help the plow, the other to pull the plow at the front, so two people Parallel coupling is called coupling." In the inscriptions, Zheng is the zhenren in the first period of Wuding era, and he is also a historian. Inscriptions no " fight" word, used only as a radical, " quiet" "The word from the fight" word, from the second " and" from " strength," " force" like the shape tools, and " plow" the beginning of the text It can be used universally as a symbol. 爭字的基本解释

爭
zhēng
同“争”。

爭字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhēng］
［《廣韻》側莖切，平耕，莊。］
亦作“爭1”。
(1)争夺；夺取。
(2)争斗；对抗。
(3)竞争；较量。
(4)计较。
(5)竞相；抢先。
(6)辩论；争论。
(7)形容辩论激烈。
(8)犹赌。
(9)相差；不够。
(10)欠。
(11)犹怎。
(12)犹只。
(13)方言。抢时间。
[②]［zhèng］
［《廣韻》側迸切，去諍，莊。］
亦作“爭2”。
(1)通“諍”。诤谏；规劝。
(2)通“挣”。

爭字的康熙字典解释

【巳集中】【爪字部】　爭； 康熙笔画：8； 页码：页688第33
〔古文〕??【唐韻】側莖切【集韻】甾耕切，?音箏。【說文】引也。从?。【徐鉉曰】音曳。?二手而曳之，爭之道也。【廣韻】競也。【書·大禹謨】汝惟不矜，天下莫與汝爭能。汝惟不伐，天下莫與汝爭功。　又【玉篇】諫也。　又訟也。【增韻】理也，辨也。【禮·曲禮】分爭辨訟，非禮不決。　又姓。【正字通】印藪有爭不識，爭同。　又【集韻】側逬切，箏去聲。義同。　又【廣韻】本作諍，諫諍也，止也。【孝經·諫諍章】天子有爭臣七人。　【韻會】俗作争，非。

考證：〔【禮·曲禮】非理不決。〕　謹照原文非理改非禮。

字源演变：

甲骨文楷体

暂无。

Contend
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［zhēng］
["Guangyun" side stems are cut, flat plowing, Zhuang. ]
Also known as "Competition 1".
(1) Compete; seize.
(2) Fight; confrontation.
(3) Competition; contest.
(4) Care about.
(5) Compete; be the first.
(6) Debate; controversy.
(7) Describe the intense debate.
(8) Still betting.
(9) Difference; not enough.
(10) Owed.
(11) Jessie.
(12) Still only.
(13) Dialects. Grab time.
[②]［zhèng］
["Guangyun" cut sideways, to criticize, Zhuang. ]
Also known as "Competition 2".
(1) Through "reputation". Exhortation; exhortation.
(2) Through "earn".

[Si Collection] [Claw Character Department] 　Strong; Kangxi Strokes: 8; Page Number: Page 688 Page 33
[Ancient text]?? [Tang Yun] side stem cut [Ji Yun] Zi Geng cut, sound zheng. [Said the text] cited also. From? . [Xu Xuan said] Yin drag. ? Second-hand and drag it, the way to fight is also. [Guang Yun] Jing Ye. 【Book·Dayu Mo】If you don't know how to do it, the world will never compete with you. If you do not fight, the world will not compete with you for merit.　[Jade articles] Admonish also.　It's also litigation. [Zeng Yun] Li Ye, distinguish it. 【Rite·Music Li】Dispute and dispute, but indecent assault.　Another last name. 【Zhengzitong】Yin Tau has disputes but does not know, and fights for the same.　[Jiyun] Side-cutting, zheng going to sound. The same meaning.　[Guangyun] This is a commentary, a remonstrance, and a stop. 【The Book of Filial Piety·Admonishment Chapter】The emperor has seven contenders.　【Rhyme Club】The vulgar disputes, non. Textual research: [[Li·Qu Li] Irresolute. 〕　I would like to change the indecent as the original text.
